page.title: 01The Village of Lavant
page.content: The village of Lavant is placed two miles north of Chichester and is surrounded by downland and farmland. It has a village hall placed in the centre of East Lavant.It also has two churches, one in East Lavant called St. Marys and the other in Mid Lavant named St. Nicholas. Most people go out of the village to work but some work on the local farms and on a small industrial estate in Mid Lavant.Lavant has a small river which starts in the woods at East Dean,and usually flows from about November until July or August.The population is approximately 1500 people.Although there are many people who have lived in the village all their lives, because of new house building there are lots of new young families who have moved into the village.
